result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Cavadias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized.  Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. No violent contact with victims. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  *****11/6/2014/ MODIFIED TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM ******No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.
